CatDescriptText: Edna McCray, 1407 Hazel Street, Republican, Third Ward and Francis White, 1413 Epiphany Street, Republican, Third Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 14, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Who is your Ward Chairman? Does he have any power? Does he exert his power?" Mrs. McCray's answer reads: "Yes, I know the ward chairman who is Tony Upsher.  As far as I'm concerned, he does have power and to my knowledge he does exert that power.  he does just as much as he can for Negroes."  Mrs. White's answer reads: "Mr. Tony Upsher is my ward chairman.  As to whether or not he has any power, I might say that Tony has just become ward chairman.  He's very intelligent and is doing his best to get things done."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Edna McCray and Francis White, seated on concrete steps of brick building with door in background
